title: Wahta Springs logo
content:
I seem to have blocked the name of this horrendous thing from my memory.

[http://www.wahtasprings.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203164616/http:/www.wahtasprings.com/ "http://www.wahtasprings.com/")

 [‹ Ken Wilber website font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203164616/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46173 "Go to previous forum topic") [What's the Dafont font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203164616/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46181 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Stephen Coles

comments.content: Never heard of such a thing. Got a link?

Sorry. Shoulda posted a link. Thanks for doing that Marcelo.

Google is your friend. :^P

I googled, but I was using the Tiffspelling. ;)

Thanks, friends!

We had [another Arquitectura post](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203164616/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46105) recently, and it’s basically an edited version of [Casablanca Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203164616/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/casablanca-rr/casablanca-rrcond-alt-light/), which is another name for a Spanish typeface by Carlos Winkow called Electra (a name also used for serif typeface by W. A Dwiggins). It’s not just a coincidence that the Jaspert sample of “Electra Estrecha Fina” includes the word ARQUITECTURA.

- Mike Yanega
